intro: Limonium oleifolium subsp. dictyocladum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and the plant is adapted to coastal and sandy environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. This subspecies is closely related to other members of the Plumbagaceae family, sharing similar ecological and morphological traits.
